intro: Michelia odora, commonly known as the fragrant Michelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Monimiaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its aromatic, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are glossy and elliptical, providing a dense canopy that supports a variety of wildlife. The fragrance of its flowers makes it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and parks.
